title: Measurements and Altitude
simpleExplanation: When hovering the mouse pointer over a craft, it will display extra measurements.

advancedExplanations.content: shows the signal strength. The second part shows the length of the connection. When connecting to a planet, this length is relative to the center of the planet.
The number to the right side of the craft indicates its altitude, relative to the celestial body that it is orbiting.

title: Green Signal Lines
simpleExplanation: These represent CommNet connections between different craft and tracking stations.

advancedExplanations.content: The solid green line mimics the similar green line in-game: It is a measure of the direct connection capability (in contrast to the

The direct connection is calculated from the combined power of all antennae on the craft, which is required for a connection to a tracking station (like the KSC), or a relay satellite. The relay connection is calculated from only the relay type antennae on the craft, this is required for relaying connections from other craft.
Here, probe A has a complete connection through to probe C, because probe B is relaying the connection. If probe C could relay to the KSC, we would have a usable control signal in-game.
